stories.title: Alec driving laws to blacklist companies that boycott the oil industry

stories.text:
Hey. I write a newsletter on humans and intentionality, and am interested in speaking with or hearing on here from people who either spend a lot of time on Usenet or using IRC, or who take strong anti-web positions and so chose to circumvent the web and instead engage with other Internet protocols like Usenet and IRC.

While I've got a broad interest in the subject (interested in hearing whatever you'd like to share), I am especially interested in hearing from people who prefer Usenet/IRC to newer, web-based social platforms (Discord, Slack, etc). Especially if you have taken a strong stance either way.

- What keeps you off the web and in non-web spaces? - What specifically about Use/IRC do you like?
stories.title: Ask HN: Who spends (or prefers to spend) more time on Usenet/IRC than on the web

stories.text: I'm aware that there are certain laws requiring that employees give advance notice before leaving a company. Curious about how common this practice is, and if folks are usually gracious enough to give even more advanced notice, e.g. four weeks when only two are required.
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you usually give X weeks notice to your employer? Why, or why not?

stories.text: I am of the opinion government should give Bitfinex only 71 million, the value of the bitcoin when it was stolen. Government should keep the rest. Opinions.
stories.title: Will Bitfinex get 3.6B $ worth of Bitcoin from the government?
